title: Requires institutions of higher education to provide course and instructional materials to students and retailers of instructional materials
summary: Requires institutions of higher education to publish a list of all courses offered to include the instructor, instructional materials needed or recommended, and expected number of students to be enrolled; requires such institutions to provide information on instructional materials to bookstores, other than those operated by the institution and provide equal access to students; requires institutions of higher education to adopt and publish a policy for complying with such provisions.

       AN ACT to amend the education law,  in  relation  to  the  provision  of
         information  relating  to  courses  offered  by institutions of higher

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The education law is amended by adding a new article 128 to
    2  read as follows:
    3                                  ARTICLE 128
    4                COURSE AND INSTRUCTIONAL MATERIAL INFORMATION
    5  SECTION 6370. COURSE CATALOG.
    6          6371. BOOKSTORES.
    7          6372. COMPLIANCE.
    8          6373. VIOLATIONS.
    9    S  6370.  COURSE  CATALOG.  1.  EVERY  INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION
   10  SHALL, NOT LESS THAN SIXTY DAYS PRIOR TO THE COMMENCEMENT OF EACH SEMES-
   11  TER OR TRIMESTER, IN WHICH COURSES OF INSTRUCTION ARE  OFFERED  BY  SUCH
   12  INSTITUTION,  ISSUE  AND  MAKE  AVAILABLE  A  LIST  OF ALL COURSES TO BE
   13  OFFERED DURING THE SEMESTER OR TRIMESTER WHICH SHALL  INCLUDE  FOR  EACH
   14  COURSE:
   15    (A) THE NAME OF THE COURSE;
   16    (B)  THE  NAME  OF  THE PERSON OR PERSONS PROVIDING INSTRUCTION IN THE
   17  COURSE;
   18    (C) A DESCRIPTION AND LISTING OF ALL INSTRUCTIONAL MATERIALS  REQUIRED
   19  OR RECOMMENDED FOR STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE COURSE; AND
   20    (D)  THE  NUMBER OF STUDENTS REASONABLY EXPECTED TO BE ENROLLED IN THE
   21  COURSE.
   22    2. THE LISTING OF COURSES REQUIRED PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS
   23  SECTION SHALL BE PROVIDED TO ALL STUDENTS AND  PROSPECTIVE  STUDENTS  OF

    1  THE  INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION, AND TO ANY OTHER PERSON SUBMITTING
    2  A REQUEST THEREFOR WITHIN ONE BUSINESS DAY OF SUCH REQUEST.
    3    3.  IN ADDITION TO THE INFORMATION REQUIRED TO BE PROVIDED BY SUBDIVI-
    4  SION ONE OF THIS SECTION, UPON SUBMISSION OF A REQUEST BY ANY PERSON AND
    5  WITHIN ONE BUSINESS DAY THEREOF, EVERY INSTITUTION OF  HIGHER  EDUCATION
    6  SHALL  PROVIDE  EVERY  SUCH  PERSON  WITH  ALL  INFORMATION  RELATING TO
    7  INSTRUCTIONAL MATERIALS THAT IS PROVIDED TO THE STORE OR STORES OPERATED
    8  BY SUCH INSTITUTION AND ENGAGED IN THE SALE OF INSTRUCTIONAL MATERIALS.
    9    4. ALL INFORMATION REQUIRED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL BE PROVIDED
   10  WITHOUT A FEE OR CHARGE.
   11    S 6371. BOOKSTORES. 1. IT SHALL BE THE POLICY OF THIS STATE  TO  ALLOW
   12  ALL  PERSONS  ENGAGED IN THE SALE OF INSTRUCTIONAL MATERIALS FOR COURSES
   13  PROVIDED AT INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION, TO  COMPETE  ON  AN  EQUAL
   14  BASIS  FOR THE SALE OF SUCH MATERIALS TO STUDENTS. TO FULFILL SUCH POLI-
   15  CY, EVERY INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION SHALL:
   16    (A) PERMIT ANY PERSON REGULARLY ENGAGED IN THE SALE  OF  INSTRUCTIONAL
   17  MATERIALS  AND  WHO  SUBMITS  A  REQUEST  THEREFOR TO PARTICIPATE IN ANY
   18  PROGRAM PROVIDING INFORMATION ON THE PURCHASE OF INSTRUCTIONAL MATERIALS
   19  BY STUDENTS, INCLUDING USED MATERIALS;
   20    (B) PROVIDE ANY PERSON REGULARLY ENGAGED IN THE SALE OF  INSTRUCTIONAL
   21  MATERIALS  AND  WHO  SUBMITS A REQUEST THEREFOR TO RECEIVE A LIST OF THE
   22  NAMES AND ADDRESSES OF ALL STUDENTS OF SUCH INSTITUTION  NOT  LESS  THAN
   23  SIXTY DAYS PRIOR TO THE COMMENCEMENT OF EACH SEMESTER OR TRIMESTER;
   24    (C)  AUTHORIZE  ANY  PERSON  REGULARLY ENGAGED IN THE SALE OF INSTRUC-
   25  TIONAL MATERIALS TO ADVERTISE THE SALE OF SUCH MATERIALS IN ANY PUBLICA-
   26  TION OR OTHER PUBLIC MEDIUM OPERATED BY SUCH INSTITUTION  IN  WHICH  THE
   27  SALE OF INSTRUCTIONAL MATERIALS IS ADVERTISED BY SUCH INSTITUTION; AND
   28    (D)  SUBJECT  TO  THE RULES AND REGULATIONS OF THE COMMISSIONER AND IN
   29  COOPERATION WITH PERSONS REGULARLY ENGAGED IN THE SALE OF  INSTRUCTIONAL
   30  MATERIALS,  PROVIDE  ACCESS TO MEANS ESTABLISHED BY SUCH INSTITUTION FOR
   31  THE PROVISION OF CREDIT TO AND BILLING OF STUDENTS FOR THE  PURCHASE  OF
   32  INSTRUCTIONAL  MATERIALS  SOLD  BY SUCH PERSONS ON THE SAME BASIS AS THE
   33  SALE OF SUCH MATERIALS WHEN MADE BY SUCH INSTITUTION.
   34    2. NO INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION SHALL  IMPOSE  A  FEE  UPON  ANY
   35  PERSON REGULARLY ENGAGED IN THE SALE OF INSTRUCTIONAL MATERIALS, FOR THE
   36  UTILIZATION  OF  ANY  OF  THE  REQUIREMENTS  OF  SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS
   37  SECTION, WHICH IS HIGHER THAN THE FEE IMPOSED UPON THE  ENTITY  OPERATED
   38  BY  SUCH  INSTITUTION THAT IS ENGAGED IN THE SALE OF EDUCATIONAL MATERI-
   39  ALS.
   40    S 6372. COMPLIANCE. EVERY INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION SHALL ESTAB-
   41  LISH AND PUBLISH A WRITTEN POLICY PROVIDING  THE  MEANS  BY  WHICH  SUCH
   42  INSTITUTION SHALL COMPLY WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE. SUCH POLI-
   43  CY  SHALL PROVIDE FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF A COMPLIANCE OFFICER, WHO SHALL
   44  BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SUCH INSTITUTION'S COMPLIANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS  OF
   45  THIS ARTICLE.
   46    S 6373. VIOLATIONS. ANY INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION WHICH VIOLATES
   47  THE  PROVISIONS  OF THIS ARTICLE SHALL BE SUBJECT TO A CIVIL FINE OF NOT
   48  MORE THAN ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS FOR EACH SUCH VIOLATION.
   49    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of July  next  succeeding
   50  the  date on which it shall have become a law; provided, that any rules,
   51  regulations  and  actions  necessary  for  the  implementation  of   the
   52  provisions of this act on its effective date are authorized and directed
   53  to be completed on or before such date.
